xxl.core.functions
Class DecoratorArrayFunction<P,R>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.AbstractFunction<P,java.util.List<R>>
      xxl.core.functions.DecoratorArrayFunction<P,R>
Type Parameters:
P - the type of the decorator list-function's parameters.
R - the most general return type of the component type of the list returned by the decorator list-function's invoke method.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Function<P,java.util.List<R>>
public class DecoratorArrayFunction<P,R>
extends AbstractFunction<P,java.util.List<R>>

A DecoratorArrayFunction invokes each function given to the constructor on the given parameters when calling the invoke method. Meaning this class defines a function from an one dimensional object space to a n-dimensional object space

f:O -->O^n with f=(f1(a),f2(a),...,fn(a))

for given functions f1,...,fn with  fi:O-->O, i=1,...,n  by composing them in a vector-like manner.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DecoratorArrayFunction

public DecoratorArrayFunction(Function<? super P,? extends R>... functions)
Constructs a new decorator array-function. The function i defined by 
   f : P --> R^n
with 
   f = ( f1(a), f2(a), ... , fn(a) ) , fi : P --> R

Parameters:
functions - the functions are separately invoked on the given parameters when calling the invoke method.
Method Detail

invoke

public java.util.List<R> invoke(java.util.List<? extends P> arguments)
Calls the invoke methods of the wrapped functions on the given parameters. The results of this invocations are gathered in an array that is returned as the result of the invoke method.

Specified by:
invoke in interface Function<P,java.util.List<R>>
Overrides:
invoke in class AbstractFunction<P,java.util.List<R>>
Parameters:
arguments - arguments passed to the given functions.
Returns:
an List<R> containing the results of the invoked functions
